title: "Type (multi level)" field and it's description
description:
General

Below you can see the list of different type of works that support team is doing in process of work with tickets. This list represents a "Type (multi level)" field that is available in scope of each ticket. Proper types allow everybody in team to filter tickets by some particular type of work and to get some proper statistics. Also such functionality allows support to optimize their list of active tickets and exclude some tasks like "Trainings" or "Maintenances"(that are waiting for some particular day) from the active list and to avoid loss of some really urgent tickets when the list of open tickets are don't fit on a single page.

Explanation of each type

Incident - type of tickets where some problems with web configuration, calls, or billing issues are detected.

Bug - type of tickets where bug in SSP or in SMG was detected.
  SSP
    Web part
      ver. 4.4
      ver. 4.5
      Other
    OS
     ver. 4.4
     ver. 4.5
     Other
  SMG
    Web part
    OS

Question- theoretical question that doesn't require investigation, only a simple explanation of the feature and how to configure it.
   SSP
     Web part
     Server part
     Other
   SMG
     Web part
     Server part
     Other
   Other

System Alert - type of tickets that mostly arrives from client's servers and indicates some issue on server (hardware, software issue or misconfiguration).
 SSP
   Replication is broken - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about broken replication.
   Low disk space - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about
   Swap usage - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about swap usage.
   DB connections limit - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about db connections limit exceeded.
 SMG 
 Other

Provisioning - type of tickets where support team provides a newly installed SIPPY system to a new clients with all needed modules, documentations and credentials for further work with newly created billing system.
Hosted server
     SSP environment
     Trial
     Standard
     SMG for environment
     Permanent
     Other
 Hosted Dedicated server
 Dedicated server
     SSP
     SMG
 Standby
 Sandbox
 Other

Maintenance- type of tickets that includes the below tasks and in most cases requires a downtime of server during it's execution.
Hardware upgrade
SSP upgrade - this type only for SSP systems (don't use it for SMG).
     OS upgrade
     Code update
     OS and Code upgrade
SMG upgrade - maintenance for the SMG server. If update connected with SMG, please use the this type.
     OS upgrade
     Code update
     OS and Code upgrade
Customer notification - ticket that depend on other ticket where maintenance should be done and created only to notify client about maintenance in another ticket.
     Hardware upgrade
     SSP update
     OS upgrade
     Code update
     OS and Code upgrade
     SMG upgrade
Other

FeatureRequest - a simple request from any licensed client to develop something new in sippy softswitch or to improve some existing feature. In case if request is connected with improvement it is very important to investigate the case attentively to ensure that it is not a bug.

Training - the individual training for one and only one company via skype/hangouts and with screen sharing to make education more efficient.

System Crash - when server has been rebooted/crashed by some unknown reason and should be investigated or escalated.

Replication - procedure of databases synchronization between main server (that calls "Master") and backup server (that calls "Standby"). 
   Standard - standard replication could be used in cases when you need to replicate 1st environment or 1st and some non-root environments.
     Configuration - to configure and synchronize databases between Master & Standby server. When replication is configured the Standby server contains the full copy of Master database. When replication is active the Standby
                           server works only in read-only mode and can't be used for the traffic routing.In such configuration Standby uses for CDRs extraction to offload DB on master.
     Restoration - procedure that allows to restore replication after some network issues.
     Other
   Old Style - this type of replication allows to replicate some non-root environments without replication of 1st environment. Very useful when you need to replicate some non-root environment on hosted server.
     Configuration
     Restoration
     Other

Failover - the procedure of configuration of databases synchronization between Master & Standby servers with the function of automatic switchover of DB and services to Standby server when Master is down. Thus Standby can take a role of master.
   Configuration
   Manual Execution
   Automatic
   Restoration
   Testing
   Other

Migration - the procedure of migration data and services to the new hardware with all customer's patches and databases.
   Hosted client
   Dedicated client
   Other

TIB configuration - the procedure of TIB module configuration from scratch (only console part). It could be done only by support team. The needed package should be installed manually and requires additional licence for proper work.

Onboarding - type of tickets that are connected with onboarding initiation and deletion. Also something that is connected with onboarding process directly.

Licence manipulation- type of tickets where environment or server requires suspension or deletion.
   Suspend licence
   Delete licence
   Downgrade capacity
   Upgrade capacity

Feedback - type of tickets where clients are providing us some feedbacks about some articles. Usually subject is similar to this one : "Article Feedback - Understanding Authentication".

Other - other type of tickets that are not match the available types.

This list represents a "Type (multi level)" field that is available in scope of each ticket. Proper types allow everybody in team to filter tickets by some particular type of work and to get some proper statistics. Also such functionality allows support to optimize their list of active tickets and exclude some tasks like "Trainings" or "Maintenances"(that are waiting for some particular day) from the active list and to avoid loss of some really urgent tickets when the list of open tickets are don't fit on a single page. System Crash - when server has been rebooted/crashed by some unknown reason and should be investigated or escalated.  Replication - procedure of databases synchronization between main server (that calls "Master") and backup server (that calls "Standby").     Standard - standard replication could be used in cases when you need to replicate 1st environment or 1st and some non-root environments.      Configuration - to configure and synchronize databases between Master & Standby server. When replication is configured the Standby server contains the full copy of Master database. When replication is active the Standby                             server works only in read-only mode and can't be used for the traffic routing.In such configuration Standby uses for CDRs extraction to offload DB on master.      Restoration - procedure that allows to restore replication after some network issues.      Other    Old Style - this type of replication allows to replicate some non-root environments without replication of 1st environment. It could be done only by support team. The needed package should be installed manually and requires additional licence for proper work.  Onboarding - type of tickets that are connected with onboarding initiation and deletion. Also something that is connected with onboarding process directly. title: Sippy Softswitch Technical Support Standard Plan (for internal use only)
description:
Sippy Softswitch Technical Support Standard Plan

INCLUDED - service provided within the Plan
ORDER - service can be ordered for additional fee, please contact Sippy
NOT INCLUDED - service is not provided within the Plan, please consider purchasing Professional or Enterprise Plan
Main Terms ValueDescription and Examples
Max number of tickets per month5Maximum number of task related tickets during the month. Questions do not count.
Base supported server capacity limit, CC2,000For any additional 1,000CC 2% is added to base support price 2%
Maximum number of licences/servers1Standard Plan is limited to one licence/server. Please contact Sippy Sales for customized plan.
Number of supported environments limit per Plan 1The limit of environments additional to the root environment allowed within the plan. Please contact sales to discuss possible customized plan.
Maximum number of customer agents in Sippy Helpdesk3The maximum number of customers contacts that can be registered in the Sippy's Helpdesk. 
Communication meansSippy HelpdeskAll requests to Sippy have to be placed via helpdesk system by the following link: https://support.sippysoft.com or by email support@sippysoft.com
Expected first response time and setting priority for the ticket10 minutes“Response time” is defined as the amount of time between when the client first creates an incident report and when the provider actually responds (automated responses don’t count) and lets the client know they’ve currently working on it.

First response will include the Priority Classification of the task as defined by Sippy engineer which will reflect on when the Sippy support start implementing the task and how frequently the customer will be informed about the implementation process.
Technical Support ServicesPlan coverageDescription and Examples
Two-week onboarding team chatIncludedAssistance via the live chat (ryver messaging system) for a newly provisioned clients. Within 2 weeks period, Sippy's best experts helps with understanding of SippySoft switch and assisting in configuration steps.
Free one-hour training within onboarding chatIncludedTraining session means a live call/meeting with a customer (via skype, hangouts) when the onboarding chat isn't efficient and some presentation/demo is needed.
ProvisioningIncludedInstallation of SippySoft switch, installation of ordered modules. 
SSP update licenceIncludedUpdate of code, OS, postgresql is included to the standard support agreement, but limited by the number of supported versions. E.g. if your Sippy version is lower than 3 releases prior to the latest one, Sippy wouldn't support it for free.
SSP update workIncludedWork related to updating the SippySoft switch code, database and OS to the latest available version.
Repartitioning of cdrsIncludedRequires in case of high volume traffic (more than 2000CC) to offload partitions by the number of stored CDRs in each. May be necessary if there is a "slow web interface" issue is detected.
IVR issues investigationIncludedSippy support may help to extract the details for the call that was done via Calling Card/Callback application. And check the reason of the issue with IVR application.
Other system log investigationIncludedSippy support may help to investigate all other logs on a Sippy switch side except sip logs that may be extracted via the web interface via Sip Log Viewer feature.
Softswitch web config questionIncludedSippy support may instruct a switch operator how to configure some call scenario in the SippySoft switch, but all actions on customer's production systems may be done only by a switch operator.
Sippy instructs on the config questions etc. only in case it is not covered in the documentation and video tutorials.
Dedicated support engineerNot IncludedDedicated support - a particular senior engineer(s) who follows your company, coordinates support related activities, provides online consultations, regular meetings, etc. The requirements to the engineer and related terms and conditions shall be agreed with each customer individually. Available only for Professional and/or Enterprise.
Weekly review calls Not IncludedRegular or on demand weekly meetings with a Dedicated Support Engineer to discuss necessary issues related to switch operations and technological developments needed (available only in a premium plan).
Server administrationNot IncludedSippy's support doesn't manage the hardware and network issues on client's servers (dedicated solution)
Additional Online training or advisory sessions ORDERIf the 1st free training has been provided, customer may request an additional training that may be ordered on a fee basis in the sales department.
Operational Improvement Team ChatORDERContinuous team chat in Ryver with the Sippy's key professionals to discuss technical, organisational and possible other issues related to the oprations improvement of the customer business.
System MigrationORDERMigration of a data or licence to a new hardware. Old server should be decommissioned and data should be removed accordingly.
Database MigrationORDERMigration of an archived database or dump to some external resource once.
Setup script to copy Database to the FTP serverORDERMigration of an archived database or dump to some external resource on periodical basis.
CDR restorationORDERRestoration of CDRs that were missed on the web interface. Restoration may be done from the sip.log file that system keeps stored on server (maximum 10 days/logs).
SIP Log investigation by supportORDERInvestigation of a sip call via the Sip Logs Viewer on the web interface.
Audit log investigation by support staffORDERAudit log feature helps to track web changes.
Swap IPs (network relocation)ORDERAny extra requests regarding the network changes should be ordered in a Sippy sales department. E.g. replace old IP's by new. Swap IP's between servers.
Softswitch server configuration workORDERAny custom configuration on the backend of server may be performed only in case if it is considered as a possible by support team and only in case if it was ordered by customer in the Sippy's sales department.
Replace HDD with a new one and Moving DB/logs to the new partitionORDERWhen customer needs to replace HDD by the new one on any production server.
Manual backup of databaseORDERDump database from command line manually on demand basis. This is an extra task that may be done only after confirmation from Sipp sales department.
SippySoft switch reinstallORDERIf customer wants to reinstall Sippy licence from scratch due to some HW issues or by HW replacement.
Restoring the cdrs from archives or archive cdrs featureORDERTo avoid archivation of CDR's that may require a further restoration, a switch operator may set the period of keeping data stored in the database and on the web, Otherwise the restoration of data from archive may be considered as an extra task for Sippy support and has to be ordered in the Sipp sales department.
Min downtime upgradeORDERUpdate with a minimal downtime may be considered if a hot/warm standby solution is configured
Urgent tickets (system outage or malfunctioning). Investigation/diagnostic fee + resolution fee.ORDERAn option that allows client to order some urgent investigation of some non-critical issue that may be considered by support team as a low priority task.
Maintenance ORDERDifferent types of maintenance that are not included in the list above
Professional Consulting ServicesPlan coverageDescription and Examples
Investigating and recommending hardware requirementsORDERInvestigation of hardware that was selected against Sippy's recommendations.
Investigating and recommending data center facilitiesORDERInvestigation of hardware issues of DC that was selected against Sippy's recommendations.
Developing custom made scenario and  related system configurationORDERDeveloping a complicated workarounds for the unavailable functionality.
Migrating client and other data from other switches to Sippy switchORDERMoving necessary data from other systems to Sippy Softswitch 
Optimizing softswitch servers infrastructureORDERDiagnoziz of the customer's system and professional advice on how the system can be optimized
Online consulting sessionORDEROne hour online session with Sippy consultants on any issue
Stress Testing of the SystemORDERTest of the servers in the conditions of pick traffic volume

Questions do not count.  Base supported server capacity limit, CC  2,000  For any additional 1,000CC 2% is added to base support price 2%  Maximum number of licences/servers  1  Standard Plan is limited to one licence/server. title: Sippysoft Service Desk Priority Levels
description:
General overview


Sippy Software Inc. provides support via the ticketing system which is based on the queue logic (first in first out) considering the priority of an incoming request.
Thus requests with the critical priority Sippy Support Department consider/investigate first by overcoming the standard queue logic. Such an approach may guarantee for every Sippy customer the fast resolution of some critical issues and fast recovery of any degraded service.


Task Priority Response time, hoursMain Criteria
Priority 1 (critical)HourlyThe customer's environment/system doesn't process calls (e.g. services totally down and customer can't run business)
Priority 2 (high) Every two hourscritical services do not work as expected (e.g web part is not responding or calls are degraded)
Priority 3 (medium)1 business dayservices are working fine but customer has some issue with system functionality (e.g. a customer-facing issues with making calls due to a misconfiguration of scenario on the web interface)
Priority 4 (low)2 business daysquestions and assistance in the configuration of some features and call scenarios


Response time commitments do not promise a complete resolution within the stated time frames. Rather, the time commitment is meant to indicate the maximum time interval in which the customer will be contacted by either the technician assigned to the ticket, or by the assigned department’s manager to initiate support activities. Every effort will be made to immediately respond to and resolve all critical issues.


Priority Definitions


Priority 1 (critical): an issue impacting the whole system. When an issue with Priority 1 occurs on the customer's end, it is important that Sippy Support Department has a clear understanding of the severity of the issue, so that the necessary resources can be applied to resolve the issue.


Examples: (but not limited by the following list):

    

  • The web interface is fully down.
  • A critical network issue due to which the whole service is down.
  • The customer's environment/system doesn't process calls.
  • The server is down (HW issue, critical Software issue). 


Priority might be changed/decreased when service is restored/renewed.


Priority 2 (high): some component/service is degraded but the major part of services are still operational and the major part of a traffic flow isn't affected. Priority could escalate to Critical if not addressed quickly.


Examples: (but not limited by the following list):

    

  • The web interface is degraded but operational;
  • The network is degraded but the core services are up and running.
  • Calls are degraded due to the issue with some component/service (e.g. media proxy is degraded).


Priority might be decreased (if service restored/renewed) or increased (if the service stopped responding totally).


Priority 3 (medium): Routine requests that impact a single user or non-critical software or hardware issue. Operation of core services isn't affected. 


Examples: (but not limited by the following list)::

    

  • Misconfiguration in call scenario which leads to a call failure.
  • Single user unable to use some component/service but for other users, the same service works fine.
  • Software/Hardware installations, upgrade, etc.

Priority might be decreased or increased depending on the provided resolution by Sippy Support Department.


Priority 4 (low): A minor service issue or some general question or assistance in configuration.

Examples (but not limited by the following list):

    

  • Assistance in configuration review.
  • Feature requests.
  • Explanation of some technical material.

Priority might be decreased or increased depending on the provided resolution by Sippy Support Department.

The customer's environment/system doesn't process calls.  The server is down (HW issue, critical Software issue).       Priority might be changed/decreased when service is restored/renewed. Feature requests.  Explanation of some technical material.   Priority might be decreased or increased depending on the provided resolution by Sippy Support Department.
